Reverse Geocoding Of Geographic Coordinates to Map Regions

Choropleth maps are a great way to visualize geo data.

Reverse geocoding is the process of back (reverse) coding of a point location (latitude, longitude) to a readable address or place name.

In this case, we don't need to know the exact address but just the name/id of a region in our map.
